The image of the swastika: shaped table circulating on the internet was verified to be a real table.
IKEA released a statement denying that t: confirming that they are not selling a swastika-shaped table.
The claim that the table was being sold: with 88 representing "HH" for "Heil Hitler," was debunked.
The existence of a swastika: shaped table created by artist David Roze in 2011 was confirmed, which featured a mirror image of a swastika and words like "peace" and "prosperity" written along its edges.
